subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Thanks and more stuff
author: bruce halliday

LC,
 
My story is similar in as I was led to my present position
in this f=
ield. we are the front line troops the trail blazers
 
hopefully we will se=
e our efforts come to fruition someday.
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-I=
TC@yahoogroups.comFrom: lcdupla@...: Thu, 20 Dec 2007 15:24:56 +0=
000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Thanks and more stuff




Oh, Bruce...I agree. Th=
e stuff I have been working on outside this ghost box stuff was completely =
led by "spirits" on the other side. My job, if you will, was to begin a web=
site and build it for the sole purpose of getting others to consider that t=
here might be more than the physical realm. That led to Angels & Ghosts in =
2004, and I had no idea why that name was given, but I went with it. I love=
 the tech side, but have felt the goal of A & G was to make people think an=
d decide for themselves. There are plenty of the debunkers, TAPS type inves=
tigators out there, and that was not the vision I had been given (though I =
like that approach). We recieve submissions from all over the world of audi=
o, pictures, videos, stories, etc, and then I post much if it monthly. Agai=
n, the site's flavor is "you decide." In the digital age, there is no way t=
o authenticate what's absolutely truth, from fiction. So, again my mantra h=
as been, "You decide." Do I think everything on A & G is of ghosts and spir=
its? Nah...not my job to anyway. I make it interesting, and allow the minds=
 of the visitors to decide. That's been my job and the spirits' beckoning. =
They want people to begin looking for more than what the five sense can bri=
ng them. I feel they speak often, but we don't listen enough. However, I al=
so feel they speak often and we think it is coincidence or better yet our o=
wn thoughts - LOL. ;) January of '07 began with a dream and a "new technolo=
gy" I was to work on that would be big. I sort of blew it off as a pizza dr=
eam, but then was led to contact people from my past for "other purposes" o=
f business This of course unwittingly led back to this whole communication =
box, again. They (spirits) will not let up on me.So I am working on project=
s and I get nudged in the spirit to get on this box thing again. I pop on h=
ere, see the latest news with the RS Hack (they bugged me as soon as it bro=
ke, but I stalled a few days) and am now running experiments, etc with it. =
I am posting articles, videos and audio about it to spread the word. More t=
o come...LCAngelsGhosts.com--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday <=
paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:>> > LC,> > They not only see a bigger p=
icture but have set all the wheels for it in motion.> These new rapid devel=
opments are not pure chance or coincidence.> We as researchers and develope=
rs have been set on a path and we will follow it until our job> is done.> >=
 Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > > To: EVP-ITC@...: lcdupla@...: Thu, 20 Dec 2007=
 00:51:14 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Thanks and more stuff> > > > > Perhap=
s those on the other side are more urgent, anxious and excited about the bo=
x breakthroughs than even we are. Could it be because they see a bigger pic=
ture coming to pass?- LC--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "psi_research" <vil=
hellm@> wrote:>> Hi Ursula,> > There is a certain urgency to Box messages -=
 sort of like they need > to convey quickly. The same thing happens in vide=
o ITC, it's like > there is but a moment and we all better pay attention. -=
Bill> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Ursula Bielski <ursulabielski@> > w=
rote:> >> > Willy, Really interested in listening to the new files. I'll le=
t > you know after.> > Just to throw in regarding EVP maker and everything =
else but the > boxes. I used EVP maker and the water method AND foreign lan=
guage > broadcast method and radio static and box fan, etc etc etc before I=
 > got my shack hack and my Joe's box, and I must admit that I have put > e=
verything else aside even though I got good results with ALL of > those oth=
er methods. There's just something very exciting about the > boxes, I think=
, that makes us forsake all others. When I started > using a hack, which Je=
ff Rezman made for me before I got the Joe's > Box, I felt it was a nervous=
 sort of experimentation--that is to say, > the loud, short, fast sound cli=
ps had me on edge, as I was used to > quiet static and water, but I think n=
ow I'm addicted to the sound and > the frenzy of it! Does anyone else feel =
this way?> > Ursula> > > > billliscomb williscomb@ wrote:> > Ursula and Mis=
ty =96 thank you very much for your feedback. > I > > really appreciate you=
 taking the time to listen, and for the > > comments, especially noting the=
 dual layers of speech. Interesting. > > Frank S. - Thanks for the recent f=
iles from EVPmaker - nice! > > There hasn't been much discussion regarding =
EVPmaker lately, so I > > wasn't' sure if it was a viable tool to use. I ha=
ven't read many > > older posts, but hope to get caught up during the holid=
ays. Have > you > > or others considered modifying speech synthesis softwar=
e to > generate > > random sounds? I wonder how something like that would w=
ork=85> > On the 16th I did three 3minute recordings and got 9 clips from >=
 > them. In this session, I was asking questions regarding a knocking > > s=
ound I heard while going to sleep or waking up about 12 years ago. > > My l=
ife situation wasn't the best at that time. It was always three > > knocks,=
 and once a doorbell, but not the doorbell for where I was > > then living.=
 Started the Knocking session by telling "Rick" that I > > got messages fro=
m previous session, got "Well, he's got patience!" > > for response. Then w=
as told, "Aye, it smells in here." Next asked > > them what sound did I hea=
r back then, and got "it was knocking > (maybe > > nothing?)" The best one =
so far is; "Our earthbound forefathers are > > video programs." A second vo=
ice keeps repeating "Ent" syllable > > during this one. I have put these fi=
les in a new folder called > > Knocking, which is under Laptop MP3s. More c=
omments there. > > I'm making progress on getting the software needed to do=
 > > linear scanning with the Radio Shark 2 USB am/fm radio and hope to > >=
 have it up and running within the next week or two. > > Thanks again to al=
l> > Willy> >> > > > > > > > ______________________________________________=
